ds.util
Interface Collection<T>

All Superinterfaces:
java.lang.Iterable<T>
All Known Subinterfaces:
List<T>, OrderedSet<T>, Set<T>
All Known Implementing Classes:
ArrayList, AVLTree, Bag, Hash, HashSet, LinkedList, OrderedList, RBTree, STree, TreeSet
public interface Collection<T>
extends Iterable<T>

The root interface in the collection hierarchy. A collection represents a group of objects, known as its elements. Some collections allow duplicate elements and others do not. Some are ordered and others unordered. A bag is the model for a Collection data structure.

Most collection classes that implement Collection, implement more specific subinterfaces like Set and List.

See Also:
Set, List, Bag

          Removes a single instance of the specified element from this collection, if it is present; Returns true if this collection is modified.

          Returns the number of elements in this collection.
 java.lang.Object[] toArray()
          Returns an array containing all of the elements in this collection.

add

boolean add(T item)
Ensures that this collection contains the specified element. Returns true if the operation inserts a new element in this collection.Returns false if this collection already contains the specified element and does not permit duplicates.

Parameters:
item - element that must occur at least once in this collection.
Returns:
true if this collection is modified.

clear

void clear()
Removes all of the elements from this collection. This collection will be empty after this method returns.
